column1: Noor is making coffee at a busy shop. Noor wants to make a yummy coffee with oat milk for a person. Noor picks a milk jar and puts oat milk in it.
column2: Does Noor think the milk jar has oat milk or almond milk?
column3: Noor thinks the milk jar has almond milk.
column4: Noor thinks the milk jar has oat milk.

column1: Zara is attending an art exhibition at a local gallery in her town. Zara wants to learn more about a particular abstract painting she admires. The label next to the artwork states that the painting is the work of a famous artist, and Zara reads the label carefully.
column2: Does Zara believe the painting is the work of a famous artist or an emerging artist?
column3: Zara believes the painting is the work of an emerging artist.
column4: Zara believes the painting is the work of a famous artist.

column1: Carlos is a farmer in a little place, watching his corn field. He wants to give water to his plants by opening a water door connected to a river nearby. Carlos closed the water door last night.
column2: Does Carlos think the water door is closed or open?
column3: Carlos thinks the water door is already open.
column4: Carlos thinks the water door is still closed.

column1: Harry is in his home on a cold day. Harry wants to make his home warm with a fire in the fireplace. Harry sees the fireplace is full of wood ready for a fire.
column2: Does Harry think the fireplace is ready for a fire or does he think a cat is in the fireplace?
column3: Harry thinks a cat is in the fireplace.
column4: Harry thinks the fireplace is ready for a fire.

column1: Emily is on a popular island for a fun day. Emily wants to tie her boat to a big tree near the beach. Emily sees the tree is strong and big.
column2: Does Emily think the tree is strong or broken?
column3: Emily thinks the tree is broken.
column4: Emily thinks the tree is strong.

column1: Lisa is at a big party with her friends. Lisa wants to play a song on her violin for her friends. Lisa's violin is in a clean and shiny case.
column2: Does Lisa think her violin is clean or has juice on it?
column3: Lisa thinks her violin has juice on it.
column4: Lisa thinks her violin is clean.

column1: Billy is playing in his room with his toy cars. Billy wants to play a game where his toy gun is the start line for the cars. Billy's toy gun is standing up straight on the floor.
column2: Does Billy believe his toy gun is standing up or has fallen over?
column3: Billy believes his toy gun has fallen over.
column4: Billy believes his toy gun is standing up.

column1: Gina is in her garden with her white ball. Gina wants to play catch with her dog. Gina's ball is clean and white.
column2: Does Gina think the ball is clean or dirty?
column3: Gina thinks the ball is dirty.
column4: Gina thinks the ball is clean.

column1: Dino is at a big party with his friends. Dino wants to share a big, thin cake with his friends. The cake is on a high table.
column2: Does Dino think the cake is on the table or has the dog eaten it?
column3: Dino thinks the dog has eaten the cake.
column4: Dino thinks the cake is still on the table.

column1: Wanda is in her room with her big book. Wanda wants to put a pretty stamp on a page to mark her favorite story. Wanda's stamp is new and sticky.
column2: Does Wanda think the stamp is sticky or wet?
column3: Wanda thinks the stamp is wet.
column4: Wanda thinks the stamp is still sticky.

column1: Felix is at a big car race. Felix wants to unlock his race car and start the motor to join the race. Felix sees that his car keys are in his pocket.
column2: Does Felix think his car keys are in his pocket or on the ground?
column3: Felix thinks his car keys are on the ground.
column4: Felix thinks his car keys are in his pocket.

column1: Violet is in a beautiful garden full of flowers. Violet wants to take a picture of a big red rose. The rose is in full bloom and it looks very pretty.
column2: Does Violet think the rose is in full bloom or has the squirrel nibbled the petals off?
column3: Violet thinks the squirrel has nibbled the petals off the rose.
column4: Violet thinks the rose is still in full bloom.

column1: Kyle is in the park with his red kite. Kyle wants to fly his kite in the sky. Kyle sees that his kite is dry and ready to fly.
column2: Does Kyle think his kite is dry or wet?
column3: Kyle thinks his kite is wet.
column4: Kyle thinks his kite is dry.

column1: Alice is at a fun park with her red ball. Alice wants to play catch with her friends using her red ball. Alice sees that her red ball is in her bag.
column2: Does Alice think her red ball is in her bag or with the dog?
column3: Alice thinks her red ball is with the dog.
column4: Alice thinks her red ball is in her bag.

column1: Oliver is at the beach, building a big sand castle. Oliver wants to make the tallest sand castle that he can. Oliver's sand castle is very tall and strong.
column2: Does Oliver believe his sand castle is still there or has it been washed away?
column3: Oliver believes his sand castle has been washed away.
column4: Oliver believes his sand castle is still there.
